body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature             Nature                   Plants in Hawaii               Animals of Hawaii               Environmental Factors               Natural Features and Ecosystems             Nature in Hawaii Hawaiian plants and animals began to evolve over 70 million years ago in nearly complete isolation. Over 90% of the native terrestrial flora and fauna in Hawai'i are found only in the Hawaiian Islands. This level of endemism surpasses all other places on Earth — even the Galapagos Islands! Please click on any of the links found on this page to learn more about plants, animals, and ecosystems in Hawai'i.         Animals   Find out more about animals in Hawai'i, including those that are endemic to Hawaii (meaning they are only found here on the islands - nowhere else in the world!). Learn about the things you can do to help protect endangered species in Hawai'i.         Plants   Find out more about Hawaiian plants here.         Environmental Factors Find out about the environmental factors affecting Hawaii.          Natural Features and Ecosystems Find out about the ecosystems in Hawai'i.          Inventory and Monitoring Program- Pacific Islands Network
title: World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument: Nature
